Methods

  • Edit
    AddWithHttpMessagesAsync(JobAddParameter, JobAddOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    AddWithHttpMessagesAsync(JobAddParameter, JobAddOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Adds a job to the specified account.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobAddHeaders>> AddWithHttpMessagesAsync(JobAddParameter job, JobAddOptions jobAddOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function AddWithHttpMessagesAsync(job As JobAddParameter, jobAddOptions As JobAddOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobAddHeaders))

    Parameters

    • job
      JobAddParameter
      JobAddParameter

      The job to be added.

    • jobAddOptions
      JobAddOptions
      JobAddOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobAddHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobAddHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    The Batch service supports two ways to control the work done as part of a job. In the first approach, the user specifies a Job Manager task. The Batch service launches this task when it is ready to start the job. The Job Manager task controls all other tasks that run under this job, by using the Task APIs. In the second approach, the user directly controls the execution of tasks under an active job, by using the Task APIs. Also note: when naming jobs, avoid including sensitive information such as user names or secret project names. This information may appear in telemetry logs accessible to Microsoft Support engineers.

    DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobDeleteOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobDeleteOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Deletes a job.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobDeleteHeaders>> DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, JobDeleteOptions jobDeleteOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function DeleteWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, jobDeleteOptions As JobDeleteOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobDeleteHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job to delete.

    • jobDeleteOptions
      JobDeleteOptions
      JobDeleteOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobDeleteHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobDeleteHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    Deleting a job also deletes all tasks that are part of that job, and all job statistics. This also overrides the retention period for task data; that is, if the job contains tasks which are still retained on compute nodes, the Batch services deletes those tasks' working directories and all their contents.

  • Edit
    DisableWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, DisableJobOption, JobDisableOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    DisableWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, DisableJobOption, JobDisableOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Disables the specified job, preventing new tasks from running.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobDisableHeaders>> DisableWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, DisableJobOption disableTasks, JobDisableOptions jobDisableOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function DisableWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, disableTasks As DisableJobOption, jobDisableOptions As JobDisableOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobDisableHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job to disable.

    • disableTasks
      DisableJobOption
      DisableJobOption

      What to do with active tasks associated with the job. requeue - Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled. terminate - Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again. wait - Allow currently running tasks to complete. Possible values include: 'requeue', 'terminate', 'wait'

    • jobDisableOptions
      JobDisableOptions
      JobDisableOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobDisableHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobDisableHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    The Batch Service immediately moves the job to the disabling state. Batch then uses the disableTasks parameter to determine what to do with the currently running tasks of the job. The job remains in the disabling state until the disable operation is completed and all tasks have been dealt with according to the disableTasks option; the job then moves to the disabled state. No new tasks are started under the job until it moves back to active state. If you try to disable a job that is in any state other than active, disabling, or disabled, the request fails with status code 409.

  • Edit
    EnableWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobEnableOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    EnableWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobEnableOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Enables the specified job, allowing new tasks to run.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobEnableHeaders>> EnableWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, JobEnableOptions jobEnableOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function EnableWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, jobEnableOptions As JobEnableOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobEnableHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job to enable.

    • jobEnableOptions
      JobEnableOptions
      JobEnableOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobEnableHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobEnableHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    When you call this API, the Batch service sets a disabled job to the enabling state. After the this operation is completed, the job moves to the active state, and scheduling of new tasks under the job resumes. The Batch service does not allow a task to remain in the active state for more than 7 days. Therefore, if you enable a job containing active tasks which were added more than 7 days ago, those tasks will not run.

    PatchWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobPatchParameter, JobPatchOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    PatchWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobPatchParameter, JobPatchOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Updates the properties of the specified job.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobPatchHeaders>> PatchWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, JobPatchParameter jobPatchParameter, JobPatchOptions jobPatchOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function PatchWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, jobPatchParameter As JobPatchParameter, jobPatchOptions As JobPatchOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobPatchHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job whose properties you want to update.

    • jobPatchParameter
      JobPatchParameter
      JobPatchParameter

      The parameters for the request.

    • jobPatchOptions
      JobPatchOptions
      JobPatchOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobPatchHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobPatchHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    This replaces only the job properties specified in the request. For example, if the job has constraints, and a request does not specify the constraints element, then the job keeps the existing constraints.

    TerminateWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, JobTerminateOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Terminates the specified job, marking it as completed.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobTerminateHeaders>> TerminateWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, string terminateReason = null, JobTerminateOptions jobTerminateOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function TerminateWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, terminateReason As String = Nothing, jobTerminateOptions As JobTerminateOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobTerminateHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job to terminate.

    • terminateReason
      String
      String

      The text you want to appear as the job's TerminateReason. The default is 'UserTerminate'.

    • jobTerminateOptions
      JobTerminateOptions
      JobTerminateOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobTerminateHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobTerminateHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    When a Terminate Job request is received, the Batch service sets the job to the terminating state. The Batch service then terminates any active or running tasks associated with the job, and runs any required Job Release tasks. The job then moves into the completed state.

  • Edit
    UpdateWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobUpdateParameter, JobUpdateOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken)
    UpdateWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, JobUpdateParameter, JobUpdateOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

    Updates the properties of the specified job.

    Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobUpdateHeaders>> UpdateWithHttpMessagesAsync(string jobId, JobUpdateParameter jobUpdateParameter, JobUpdateOptions jobUpdateOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function UpdateWithHttpMessagesAsync(jobId As String, jobUpdateParameter As JobUpdateParameter, jobUpdateOptions As JobUpdateOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobUpdateHeaders))

    Parameters

    • jobId
      String
      String

      The ID of the job whose properties you want to update.

    • jobUpdateParameter
      JobUpdateParameter
      JobUpdateParameter

      The parameters for the request.

    • jobUpdateOptions
      JobUpdateOptions
      JobUpdateOptions

      Additional parameters for the operation

    • customHeaders
      Dictionary<String, List<String>>
      Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

      The headers that will be added to request.

    • cancellationToken
      CancellationToken
      CancellationToken

      The cancellation token.

    Returns

    • Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<JobUpdateHeaders>>
      Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of JobUpdateHeaders))

    Exceptions

    • BatchErrorException
      BatchErrorException

      Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

    Remarks

    This fully replaces all the updateable properties of the job. For example, if the job has constraints associated with it and if constraints is not specified with this request, then the Batch service will remove the existing constraints.
